title: Tri-State hoopsters converge on CMHS
maintext:
ONA — On a cold, snowy day that postponed or canceled baseball and softball games throughout the Tri-State, youth sports still were played.
From West Virginia, Ohio and Kentucky, 42 basketball teams converged on Cabell Midland High School on Saturday to participate in the North American Youth Sports Tournament.
The basketball event featured boys and girls players in fifth through 12th grades and was headed by Cabell Midland girls coach Matt Adkins.
The teams brought colorful nicknames such as the WV Rim Rockers, East Kentucky Eliminators, West Virginia Sharp Shooters, WV Xplosion, Southern Ohio Shockers, West Virginia Above the Rim, Kentucky Rage, East Kentucky Cobras, WV Pony Express, WV Dream Ballers, KY Maroon Platoon and others.
SEND US YOUR YOUTH SPORTS SCHEDULES
The Herald-Dispatch would enjoy printing schedules/results and covering stories featuring your youth sports league, team and players on our Youth Sports pages.
To submit schedules, email them to tstephens@herald-dispatch.com. Please make sure to identify the name of your league, age group and sport.
Also, please include dates, times and location of all games.
For more information, contact Tim Stephens at 304-526-2759 or at tstephens@herald-dispatch.com.
